actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

official_title: A bill to require studies and guidelines for breast cancer screening for women ages 40-49, and for other purposes.
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: Breast Cancer Screening Act of 1997 - Directs the Director of the National Cancer Institute to: (1) conduct adequately designed studies to determine the benefit of screening women ages 40-49 through mammography and other emerging technologies; and (2) reissue the guideline rescinded in 1993 for mammography for women ages 40-49; or (3) amend the Institute statement of scientific fact on breast cancer screening to clearly state that the uncertainty of evidence for women in this age group is due to the limitations of existing studies (as of the date of issuance of the statement); and (4) direct the public to consider guidelines issued by other organizations.

titles.title: A bill to require studies and guidelines for breast cancer screening for women ages 40-49, and for other purposes.
